alert.note: Alert for Sampson; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 7:25PM EDT until July 01 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Cumberland, Harnett, Hoke, Johnston, Lee, Moore, Richmond, Sampson and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Sanford, Southern Pines, Raeford, Lillington, Carthage, Fort Bragg, Pinehurst, Dunn, Aberdeen, Angier, Benson, Hoffman, Godwin, Pope AFB, Spring Lake, Erwin, Eastover, Whispering Pines and Coats. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Spruce St at Little Cross Creek, Blounts Creek near Robeson St, Cross Creek at Ray Ave, Rockfish Rd at Gully Branch, Puppy Creek near US-401, Hwy 501 at Deep River and Patterson Creek, Lower River Rd at Little Shaddox Creek and Lick Creek, Little Buffalo Creek near the Riverbirch Shopping Center, Glendon-Carthage Rd and Rascob Rd, Kelly Plantation Rd at Hwy 22, US 1 near Aberdeen, Little River at Long Point Rd near Vass, Cranes Creek along McPherson Rd and Buffalo Creek near Riverview Acres.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
